abstract: JPMorgan Chase announced on Monday that it has appointed Barry Zubrow as its chief risk officer, a position that had been vacant since Don Wilson retired last year. In some ways, though, the bank seems to have done better than its rivals even without an official top risk manager — for now, at least.
